org.jcvi.jillion.assembly

Interface AssembledReadBuilder<R extends AssembledRead>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Rangeable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    AceAssembledReadBuilder, AsmAssembledReadBuilder, TasmAssembledReadBuilder, TigrContigReadBuilder

    public interface AssembledReadBuilder<R extends AssembledRead>
extends Rangeable
    Builds an AssembledRead for a specific contig. Methods in this interface can change the bases of this read or shift where on the reference (or contig consensus) this read lands.
    Author:
    dkatzel

      • shift

        AssembledReadBuilder<R> shift(int numberOfBases)
        Change the gapped start offset of this read by shifting it to the given number of gapped bases.
        Parameters:
        numberOfBases - the number of gapped bases this read should get shifted by. A positive value will increase this read's gapped start offset' a negative value will decrease this read's gapped start offset. A value of 0 will cause no change.
        Returns:
        this.

      • build

        R build(NucleotideSequence contigConsensus)
        Creates a new AssembledRead instance using the given contig consensus sequence (which must be have bases covering all this read's positions from read's begin to read's end gapped offsets) and the current values given to this builder.
        Parameters:
        contigConsensus - the reference or contig consensus sequence to use.
        Returns:
        a new AssembledRead instance; will never be null.

      • reAbacus

        AssembledReadBuilder<R> reAbacus(Range gappedValidRangeToChange,
                                 NucleotideSequence newBasecalls)
        Modify the gapped basecall sequence of this read to change only the gaps of the given subsequence. Sometimes, assembly errors or new alignments mean that parts of underlying reads may have to get re-gapped to make better alignments. This method allows partial sequences to get modified so that their gapped sequence can be modified without changing the non-gap bases.
        Parameters:
        gappedValidRangeToChange - the subsequence of the read to change in gapped valid range coordinate system (only has long as the length of the read).
        newBasecalls - the new gapped NucleotideSequence to replace the bases previously existing in the gappedValidRangeToChange range. The new basecalls do not have to have the same length as the old values but must have the same ungapped sequence.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the ungapped version of the newBasecalls does not match the ungapped version of the bases to be replaced.

        Get the gapped length of this read that aligns to the reference.

      • asRange

        Range asRange()
        Get this Rangeable expressed as a Range.

        Get the gapped start and end offsets of this read against this reference as a Range.

        Specified by:
        asRange in interface Rangeable
        Returns:
        a Range object, the return value might be cached.

      • getCurrentNucleotideSequence

        NucleotideSequence getCurrentNucleotideSequence()
        Get the current gapped bases of this read as a NucleotideSequence. This sequence is immutable and not backed by this builder so any if future calls to this class modify the basecalls of this read, then the NucleotideSequence that was previously returned by this method will be out of sync.
        Returns:
        a NucleotideSequence of the current (possibly modified) basecalls of this read; never null.

      • append

        AssembledReadBuilder<R> append(Nucleotide base)
        Appends the given base to the end of the builder's mutable sequence.
        Parameters:
        base - a single nucleotide sequence to be appended to the end our builder.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if base is null.

      • append

        AssembledReadBuilder<R> append(Iterable<Nucleotide> sequence)
        Appends the given sequence to the end of the builder's mutable sequence.
        Parameters:
        sequence - the nucleotide sequence to be appended to the end our builder.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if sequence is null.

      • append

        AssembledReadBuilder<R> append(String sequence)
        Appends the given sequence to the end of the builder's mutable sequence. Any whitespace in the input string will be ignored. This method is able to parse both '*' (consed) and '-' (TIGR) as gap characters.
        Parameters:
        sequence - the nucleotide sequence to be appended to the end our builder.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if sequence is null.

      • insert

        AssembledReadBuilder<R> insert(int offset,
                               String sequence)
        Inserts the given sequence to the builder's mutable sequence starting at the given offset. If any nucleotides existed downstream of this offset before this insert method was executed, then those nucleotides will be shifted by n bases where n is the length of the given sequence to insert. Any whitespace in the input string will be ignored. This method is able to parse both '*' (consed) and '-' (TIGR) as gap characters.
        Parameters:
        offset - the GAPPED offset into this mutable sequence to begin insertion.
        sequence - the nucleotide sequence to be inserted at the given offset.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if sequence is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if offset is invalid. return this.

      • replace

        AssembledReadBuilder<R> replace(int offset,
                                Nucleotide replacement)
        Replace the Nucleotide at the given offset with a different nucleotide.
        Parameters:
        offset - the gapped offset to modify.
        replacement - the new Nucleotide to replace the old Nucleotide at that location.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if replacement is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if offset is invalid.

      • delete

        AssembledReadBuilder<R> delete(Range range)
        Deletes the nucleotides from the given range of this partially constructed NucleotideSequence. If the given range is empty, then the nucleotideSequence will not be modified. If the range extends beyond the currently built sequence, then this will delete until the end of the sequence.
        Parameters:
        range - the range to delete can not be null.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if range is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if range's start is negative or greater than this nucleotide sequence's current length.

      • getNumGaps

        int getNumGaps()

      • getNumNs

        int getNumNs()

      • getNumAmbiguities

        int getNumAmbiguities()

      • prepend

        AssembledReadBuilder<R> prepend(String sequence)
        Inserts the given sequence the beginning of the builder's mutable sequence. This is the same as calling insert(0,sequence)
        Parameters:
        sequence - the nucleotide sequence to be inserted at the beginning.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if sequence is null.
        See Also:
        insert(int, String)

      • insert

        AssembledReadBuilder<R> insert(int offset,
                               Iterable<Nucleotide> sequence)
        Inserts the given sequence to the builder's mutable sequence starting at the given offset. If any nucleotides existed downstream of this offset before this insert method was executed, then those nucleotides will be shifted by n bases where n is the length of the given sequence to insert.
        Parameters:
        offset - the gapped offset into this mutable sequence to begin insertion. If the offset = the current length then this insertion is treated as an append.
        sequence - the nucleotide sequence to be inserted at the given offset.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if sequence is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if offset < 0 or > current sequence length.

      • insert

        AssembledReadBuilder<R> insert(int offset,
                               Nucleotide base)
        Inserts the given Nucleotide to the builder's mutable sequence at the given offset. If any nucleotides existed downstream of this offset before this insert method was executed, then those nucleotides will be shifted by 1 base.
        Parameters:
        offset - the GAPPED offset into this mutable sequence to begin insertion.
        base - the Nucleotide to be inserted at the given offset.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if base is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if offset < 0 or > current sequence length.

      • prepend

        AssembledReadBuilder<R> prepend(Iterable<Nucleotide> sequence)
        Inserts the given sequence the beginning of the builder's mutable sequence. This is the same as calling insert(0,sequence)
        Parameters:
        sequence - the nucleotide sequence to be inserted at the beginning.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if sequence is null.
        See Also:
        insert(int, Iterable)

      • trim

        AssembledReadBuilder<R> trim(Range trimRange)
        Trim this read to only contain the sequence of the given gapped range. This read's valid range will now be modified to contain only the bases in the trim range.
        Parameters:
        trimRange - the gapped range to modify the valid bases.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if range is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if range is beyond the current sequence valid range.

      • copy

        AssembledReadBuilder<R> copy()
        Create a new AssembledReadBuilder instance whose data is a copy of this object. Any modifications to this object or the returned copy will not be reflected in the other.
        Returns:
        a new AssembledReadBuilder instance; never null.
